DataElement.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Assessment Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study that are related to assessments of any activities that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease, as outlined in the clinical trial protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Assessment Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is not treated wit
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is not treated with adjuvant chemotherapy, RT will be administered within 12 weeks of definitive surgery.

ReferenceDocuments.name: EA1142_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been off chemotherapy for a minimum of 2 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is not treated with adjuvant chemotherapy, RT will be administered within 16 weeks of definitive surgery.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SWOG - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have an existing MammaPrint assay test with MP2 status that was done within 12 weeks prior to S2206 Step 1 Registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a MammaPrint test completed as part of usual care and is the patient's tumor in the binary "Low" category?
